properties.areaDesc: Coastal Waters from Stonington, ME to Port Clyde, ME out 25 NM; Penobscot Bay; Coastal Waters from Port Clyde, ME to Cape Elizabeth, ME out 25 NM; Coastal Waters from Cape Elizabeth, ME to Merrimack River, MA out 25 NM
properties.headline: Heavy Freezing Spray Advisory issued January 15 at 2:49PM EST until January 17 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Gale Warning, north winds 20 to 30 kt with
gusts up to 40 kt and seas 5 to 8 feet expected. For the
Freezing Spray Advisory, light accumulation of freezing spray
expected.

* WHERE...Coastal waters from Merrimack River, MA to Stonington,
ME out to 25 NM, including Penobscot Bay.

* WHEN...For the Gale Warning, from noon Thursday to noon EST
Friday. For the Freezing Spray Advisory, from 2 AM to 5 PM EST
Friday.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in freezing spray is hazardous.
Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic components
inoperative. Ice accretion on decks and superstructures may
result in some loss of stability. Strong winds will cause
hazardous seas which could capsize or damage vessels and
reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should prepare for accumulation of ice on their vessel
and consider altering plans to avoid or mitigate these hazardous
navigating conditions.

Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO NOON EST FRIDAY... ...FREEZING SPRAY ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 5 PM EST FRIDAY
